Class FloatImage

Kernel ANSI C FloatImage routines, last updated 7/15/2002. More...

FloatImage C only
 Kernel ANSI C only routines, last updated 12/5/1999.

struct  TFloatImage
 An image containing pixels of type FLOAT32. More...

 Loads given file into "pInfo", all previous information in pInfo is destroyed.

bool kF_Save (const char *FileName, TFloatImage *pInfo)
 Saves given file to disc, the file name must comply with the same rules as in kF_Load.

bool kF_SetBorder (UINT16 Size, FLOAT32 Color, TFloatImage *pInfo)
 Sets a border around image of size "Size", initialised to "Color".

bool kF_SetBorderSize (UINT16 Size, TFloatImage *pInfo)
 Sets a border around image of size "Size", not initialised.

bool kF_SetPeriodicBorder (unsigned short BorderSize, TFloatImage *pInfo)
 Expands the image periodically in the border of size BorderSize.

Detailed Description

Kernel ANSI C FloatImage routines, last updated 7/15/2002.

Basic image functions for pixels of type float, to be used as stand alone c functions, also used by the IPL98 C++ library. The functions works on the TFloatImage structure. These functions are part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
1.41
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen edr@mip.sdu.dk (except arithmetic and kF_CopyDisplace) Ivar Balslev, ivb@mip.sdu.dk (arithmetic and kF_CopyDisplace)

Function Documentation

bool kF_Add (  TFloatImage *    pImg,
TFloatImage *    pAddend
) 
 

calulates the sum of two TFloatImages.

The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
pImg  is a pointer to the source-destination image of type TFloatImage
pAddend  is a pointer to the image of type TFloatImage to be added
Returns :
False if one or both of the images involved are empty or have different size
Version:
0.80
Author:
Implemented by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)

bool kF_AllocImage (  UINT32    Width,
UINT32    Height,
TFloatImage *    pInfo
) 
 

Initialises a new image with given dimensions.

All pixel colors are initialised to 0. Sets Origin to "RAM", origo to (0,0), size of border to 0 and clears the history.

Parameters:
Width  The width of image in pixels.
Height  The height of image in pixels.
Returns :
false, if pInfo is a NULL pointer.
See also:
kF_AllocImageFast

Initialises a new image with given dimensions.

Pixel colors are not initialised. Sets Origin to "RAM", origo to (0,0), size of border to 0 and clears the history.

bool kF_CopyDisplace (  int    dx,
int    dy,
TFloatImage *    pImg
) 
 

performs a displacement so that (dx,dy) in the old picture becomes (0,0).

Periodic continuation is assumed. The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
dx  is the horizontal displacement
dy  is the vertical displacement
pImg  is a pointer to the source image
Returns :
False if *pImg is empty
Version:
0.80
Author:
Implemented by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)

bool kF_CopyFromByte (  TFloatImage *    pDest,
TImage *    pSource
) 
 

copies a TImage into a TFloatImage.

*pDest attains the same dimensions as the *pSource. History from *pSource is copied to *pDest, old history in *pDest is deleted.

Parameters:
pDest  a pointer to the destination image
pSource  apointer to the source image
Returns :
False if source image is empty
Version:
0.80
Author:
Implemented by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)

bool kF_CopyFromComplex (  COMPLEXCHOISE    mode,
TFloatImage *    pDest,
TComplexImage *    pSource
) 
 

copies partially a TComplexImage into a TFloatImage.

pDest attains the same dimensions as *PSource, and mode determines which part of the source image is copied. History from *pSource is copied to *pDest, old history in *pDest is deleted.

Parameters:
mode  determines which part is copied: if mode==1 the real part is copied, if mode==2 the imaginary part is copied. Otherwise the modulus is copied,
mode  Determines what part of the complex image is to be copied. The values are COMPLEX_REAL, COMPLEX_IMAGINARY, or COMPLEX_MODULUS.
pDest  a pointer to the destination image
pSource  a pointer to the source image
Returns :
False if source image is empty
Version:
0.80
Author:
Implemented by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)

bool kF_CopyImage (  TFloatImage *    pDest,
const TFloatImage *    pSource
) 
 

Copies whole image from "pSource" to "pDest".

All information is copied to the destination image including border pixels, palette and history. Previous data in "pDest" are destroyed, including the old history. Origin is set to RAM. File information is left empty.

Returns :
False, if source and destination image is the same.

bool kF_CopySubImage (  int    xmin,
int    ymin,
int    xmax,
int    ymax,
TFloatImage *    pDest,
const TFloatImage *    pSource
) 
 

Copies rectangel from "pSource" to "pDest".

Starting from (xmin,ymin) (including min values) and ending at (xmax,ymax) (excluding max values). Previous data in "pDest" are destroyed. Origin is set to RAM. Adds to the history.

Returns :
false if rectangel is outside dimensions of source image or if source image is empty.

Referenced by kF_FlipHorisontal().

bool kF_CutOrZeroPad (  TFloatImage *    Dest,
TFloatImage *    pSource
) 
 

copies an image into another of different size without scaling.

The origin is retained. For increasing width/height, zero padding is applied. Simple cuts are applied for reduced width/height. The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
pDest  must be allocated prior to calling
pSource  is a pointer to the source image
Returns :
False if *pSource and/or *pDest are empty
Version:
0.80
Author:
Implemented by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)

void kF_EmptyImage (  TFloatImage *    pInfo ) 
 

Deletes all allocated memory for image, origo reset to (0,0), sets values in pInfo to zero and all pointers to NULL.

All structures inside TFloatImage is emptied with their corresponding empty-function. Origin is set to "EMPTY", The history is cleared.

void kF_InitImage (  TFloatImage *    pInfo ) 
 

Sets all the pointers in pInfo to NULL, Origin to EMPTY and origo to (0,0).

All structures inside TImage is initialised with their corresponding init-function. Allways call this function when creating a new TFloatImage variable.

bool kF_Load (  const char *    PathAndFileName,
TFloatImage *    pInfo
) 
 

Loads given file into "pInfo", all previous information in pInfo is destroyed.

The file name must include a relative or absolut path and the name of the file with extension, both characters '/' and '\' can be used to seperate folder names (remember to "escape" the character '\', ex. "c:\\test.bmp"). The type of the file is determined by the given extension. Origin is set to "DISC". Adds to the history.

Parameters:
PathAndFileName  Filename (including the path) to be loaded.
Returns :
False if the syntacs of PathAndFileName is wrong, the file is not found or the format of the file is wrong.

Definition at line 191 of file f_kernel_functions.c.

TFloatImage *    pFactor
) 
 

calculates product of two images The border (if present) is not affected.

Adds to the history.

Parameters:
pImg  is a pointer to the source-destination image of type TFloatImage

Returns :

FLOAT32    Color,
TFloatImage *    pInfo
) 
 

Sets a border around image of size "Size", initialised to "Color".

Parameters:
Size  Size of border in pixels to be added in each direction.
Color  The color of the new border
Returns :
true if pInfo is not empty.

bool kF_SetPeriodicBorder (  unsigned short    BorderSize,
TFloatImage *    pInfo
) 
 

Expands the image periodically in the border of size BorderSize.

If a border of size BorderSize is present in pInfo it is used, otherwise a new border of BorderSize is created.

Parameters:
BorderSize  Size of border to copy image periodically to.
Returns :
false if BorderSize is bigger than either width or height of pInfo.

bool kF_Subtract (  TFloatImage *    pImg,
TFloatImage *    pSubtrahend
) 
 

calulates the difference of two TFloatImages.

The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
pImg  is a pointer to the source-destination image of type TFloatImage
pSubtrahend  is a pointer to the image of type TFloatImage to be subtracted
Returns :
False if one or both of the images involved are empty or have different size

0.80
